exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 2 branches.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
u: nat
q: nat
l: nat

Goal:
0 < l -> is_cipher_of (fun _ : nat => 1) u <-> l + 1 < q /\ (exists u1 : nat, seqs_of_ones u u1)

Premises:
seqs_of_ones = fun u u1 : nat => l + 1 < q /\ u = ∑ l (fun i : nat => power (power (S i) 2) r) /\ u1 = ∑ l (fun i : nat => power (power (S (S i)) 2) r) : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments seqs_of_ones (_ _)%nat_scope
is_cipher_of = fun (f : nat -> nat) (a : nat) => l + 1 < q /\ (forall i : nat, i < l -> f i < power q 2) /\ a = ∑ l (fun i : nat => f i * power (power (S i) 2) r) : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_cipher_of _%function_scope _%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
seqs_of_ones_dio : forall u u1 : nat, seqs_of_ones u u1 < -> l = 0 /\ u = 0 /\ u1 = 0 /\ 2 <= q \/ 0 < l /\ l + 1 < q /\ (exists u2 w r0 r1 p1 p2 : nat, r0 = r /\ r1 + 1 = r0 /\ p1 = power (1 + l) 2 /\ p2 = power p1 r0 /\ 1 + r1 * w = r0 * p2 /\ u * u = u1 + u2 /\ u1 = u * u ⇣ w /\ u2 = u * u ⇣ (2 * w) /\ r0 * r0 + u1 = u + p2 /\ divides (r0 * r0 * r0 * r0) u1)
const1_cn : forall l q : nat, 0 < l -> l + 1 < q -> forall u u1 : nat, u = ∑ l (fun i : nat => power (power (S i) 2) (power (4 * q) 2)) -> u1 = ∑ l (fun i : nat => power (power (S (S i)) 2) (power (4 * q) 2)) -> exists w u2 : nat, 1 + (power (4 * q) 2 - 1) * w = power (S (power (S l) 2)) (power (4 * q) 2) /\ u * u = u1 + u2 /\ u1 = u * u ⇣ w /\ u2 = u * u ⇣ (2 * w) /\ power 2 (power (4 * q) 2) + u1 = u + power (power (S l) 2) (power (4 * q) 2) /\ divides (power 4 (power (4 * q) 2)) u1
obtain_u_u1_value : forall l q : nat, 0 < l -> l + 1 < q -> forall w u u1 u2 : nat, 1 + (power (4 * q) 2 - 1) * w = power (S (power (S l) 2)) (power (4 * q) 2) -> u * u = u1 + u2 -> u1 = u * u ⇣ w -> u2 = u * u ⇣ (2 * w) -> power 2 (power (4 * q) 2) + u1 = u + power (power (S l) 2) (power (4 * q) 2) -> divides (power 4 (power (4 * q) 2)) u1 -> u = ∑ l (fun i : nat => power (power (S i) 2) (power (4 * q) 2)) /\ u1 = ∑ l (fun i : nat => power (power (S (S i)) 2) (power (4 * q) 2))
const_u_square : forall l q : nat, 0 < l -> l + 1 < q -> forall (m k' u w : nat) (f : nat -> nat), 2 * m < power (4 * q) 2 -> w = ∑ k' (fun i : nat => power i (power (4 * q) 2)) -> u = ∑ m (fun i : nat => power (f i) (power (4 * q) 2)) -> u * u = ∑ m (fun i : nat => power (2 * f i) (power (4 * q) 2)) + ∑ m (fun i : nat => ∑ i (fun j : nat => 2 * power (f i + f j) (power (4 * q) 2)))
is_cipher_of_0 : forall (f : nat -> nat) (a : nat), l = 0 -> is_cipher_of f a < -> 1 < q /\ a = 0
const_u1_meet : forall l q : nat, 0 < l -> l + 1 < q -> forall (m k k' u w : nat) (f : nat -> nat), 2 * m < power (4 * q) 2 -> (forall i : nat, i < m -> f i <= k) -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < m -> f i < f j) -> w = ∑ k' (fun i : nat => power i (power (4 * q) 2)) -> u = ∑ m (fun i : nat => power (f i) (power (4 * q) 2)) -> 2 * k < k' -> forall p : nat, p = u * u ⇣ w < -> p = ∑ m (fun i : nat => power (2 * f i) (power (4 * q) 2))
const_u2_meet : forall l q : nat, 0 < l -> l + 1 < q -> forall (m k k' u w : nat) (f : nat -> nat), 2 * m < power (4 * q) 2 -> (forall i : nat, i < m -> f i <= k) -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < m -> f i < f j) -> w = ∑ k' (fun i : nat => power i (power (4 * q) 2)) -> u = ∑ m (fun i : nat => power (f i) (power (4 * q) 2)) -> 2 * k < k' -> (forall i : nat, i < m -> f i = power (S i) 2) -> forall p : nat, p = u * u ⇣ (2 * w) < -> p = ∑ m (fun i : nat => ∑ i (fun j : nat => 2 * power (f i + f j) (power (4 * q) 2)))
Hu1 : forall l q : nat, 0 < l -> l + 1 < q -> forall (m k' u w : nat) (f : nat -> nat), 2 * m < power (4 * q) 2 -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < m -> f i < f j) -> w = ∑ k' (fun i : nat => power i (power (4 * q) 2)) -> u = ∑ m (fun i : nat => power (f i) (power (4 * q) 2)) -> ∑ m (fun i : nat => power (2 * f i) (power (4 * q) 2)) = msum nat_join 0 m (fun i : nat => 1 * power (2 * f i) (power (4 * q) 2))
all_ones_dio : forall r : nat, 2 <= r -> forall l w : nat, w = ∑ l (fun i : nat => power i r) < -> 1 + (r - 1) * w = power l r
all_ones_joins : forall l q : nat, 0 < l -> l + 1 < q -> forall n w : nat, w = ∑ n (fun i : nat => power i (power (4 * q) 2)) -> w = msum nat_join 0 n (fun i : nat => 1 * power i (power (4 * q) 2))
Hu2_w : forall l q : nat, 0 < l -> l + 1 < q -> forall (m k k' u w : nat) (f : nat -> nat), 2 * m < power (4 * q) 2 -> (forall i : nat, i < m -> f i <= k) -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < m -> f i < f j) -> w = ∑ k' (fun i : nat => power i (power (4 * q) 2)) -> u = ∑ m (fun i : nat => power (f i) (power (4 * q) 2)) -> ∑ m (fun i : nat => ∑ i (fun j : nat => 2 * power (f i + f j) (power (4 * q) 2))) ⇣ w = 0
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
all_ones_2_joins : forall l q : nat, 0 < l -> l + 1 < q -> forall n w : nat, w = ∑ n (fun i : nat => power i (power (4 * q) 2)) -> 2 * w = msum nat_join 0 n (fun i : nat => 2 * power i (power (4 * q) 2))
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
is_cipher_of_equiv : forall (f1 f2 : nat -> nat) (a b : nat), is_cipher_of f1 a -> is_cipher_of f2 b -> a = b < -> (forall i : nat, i < l -> f1 i = f2 i)
is_cipher_of_inj : forall (f1 f2 : nat -> nat) (a : nat), is_cipher_of f1 a -> is_cipher_of f2 a -> forall i : nat, i < l -> f1 i = f2 i
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
is_cipher_of_fun : forall (f1 f2 : nat -> nat) (a b : nat), (forall i : nat, i < l -> f1 i = f2 i) -> is_cipher_of f1 a -> is_cipher_of f2 b -> a = b
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
msum_S : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), msum m u (S n) f = m (f 0) (msum m u n (fun n0 : nat => f (S n0)))
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
msum_0 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (f : nat -> X), msum m u 0 f = u
sum_powers_ortho : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall (n : nat) (f e : nat -> nat), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i < r) -> (forall i j : nat, i < n -> j < n -> e i = e j -> i = j) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => f i * power (e i) r) = msum nat_join 0 n (fun i : nat => f i * power (e i) r)
g_full : forall (q m k : nat) (f : nat -> nat), (forall i : nat, i < m -> f i <= k) -> (forall i j : nat, i < j < m -> f i < f j) -> {g : nat -> nat | ∑ m (fun i : nat => ∑ i (fun j : nat => power (f i + f j) (power (4 * q) 2))) = ∑ (2 * k) (fun i : nat => g i * power i (power (4 * q) 2)) /\ (forall i : nat, g i <= m)}
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
msum_ext : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (f g : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i = g i) -> msum m u n f = msum m u n g
natr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N * Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe2
msum_plus1 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), msum m u (S n) f = m (msum m u n f) (f n)
Hg1 : forall (q m k : nat) (f : nat -> nat) (Hf1 : forall i : nat, i < m -> f i <= k) (Hf2 : forall i j : nat, i < j < m -> f i < f j), ∑ m (fun i : nat => ∑ i (fun j : nat => 2 * power (f i + f j) (power (4 * q) 2))) = ∑ (2 * k) (fun i : nat => 2 * proj1_sig (g_full q f Hf1 Hf2) i * power i (power (4 * q) 2))
Nat.lt_1_2 = (fun lemma : 2 = 2 => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.lt_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive 1) 2 2 lemma) Nat.two_succ (Nat.lt_succ_diag_r 1) : 1 < 2
Nat.log2_up = fun a : nat => match 1 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.log2 (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.log2_up _%nat_scope
Nat.log2_succ_double : forall a : nat, 0 < a -> Nat.log2 (2 * a + 1) = S (Nat.log2 a)
power_decomp_unique : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> forall (n : nat) (f a b : nat -> nat), (forall i j : nat, i < j < n -> f i < f j) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> a i < p) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> b i < p) -> ∑ n (fun i : nat => a i * power (f i) p) = ∑ n (fun i : nat => b i * power (f i) p) -> forall i : nat, i < n -> a i = b i
bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ divides 2 p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ divides (3 + 2 * n) p)
Nat.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
Nat.lt_0_1 = (fun lemma : 1 = 1 => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.lt_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive 0) 1 1 lemma) Nat.one_succ (Nat.lt_succ_diag_r 0) : 0 < 1
nat_meet_powers_neq : forall q : nat, 0 < q -> forall r : nat, r = power q 2 -> forall i j a b : nat, i <> j -> a < r -> b < r -> a * power i r ⇣ (b * power j r) = 0

``` 
intros.
intros H.
destruct H as [H1 H2].
split.
- apply H1.
- destruct H2 as [H3 H4].
  split.
  + apply H3.
  + apply H4.
```

original: intros. intros H. destruct H as [H1 H2]. split. - apply H1. - destruct H2 as [H3 H4]. split. + apply H3. + apply H4.
